"The interesting thing about this movie is that I did not pitch them, they pitched me. That's a rare thing," DeVernay told Collider recently. "It happened because there were people at Disney that were forward thinking, so I have to tip my hat to them. It's the same company that asked Taika Waititi to make Thor [Ragnarok], that had Ryan Coogler make Panther, and that has Niki Caro as the next woman with a $100 million budget, making Mulan. They're really doing some interesting things there, so I tip my hat to them."Tendo Nagenda, Disney's Vice President of Production, "saw something in Selma and he, along with Jim Whitaker and Sean Bailey, brought me in to convince me to do the book.
